content.title: COPD Definition and Classification
content.summary: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease - persistent airflow limitation due to airway and/or alveolar abnormalities
key_points: GOLD staging: GOLD 1-4 by FEV1 severity
GOLD ABCD: symptom burden + exacerbation history
Emphysema (alveolar destruction) vs chronic bronchitis (airway inflammation)
Smoking is primary risk factor; alpha-1 antitrypsin deficiency in young nonsmokers

statement.text: COPD is a heterogeneous lung condition characterized by chronic respiratory symptoms (dyspnea, cough, sputum production) due to airway and/or alveolar abnormalities, with persistent often progressive airflow limitation confirmed by spirometry (post-bronchodilator FEV1/FVC <0.70).
statement.formal: COPD = Respiratory symptoms + Airflow obstruction (FEV1/FVC <0.70 post-BD) + Chronic/progressive course

explanation.intuition: COPD is like trying to breathe through a straw that's partially blocked (airway obstruction) while also having fewer bubbles to exchange air (emphysema). The lungs can't fully empty, trapping air and making each breath less efficient.
explanation.key_insight: COPD severity is assessed in two dimensions: (1) physiologic - GOLD 1-4 based on FEV1, and (2) clinical - symptom burden and exacerbation history. Both inform treatment decisions. A patient with mild obstruction but frequent exacerbations may need more aggressive therapy.

definitions_glossary.COPD: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease - persistent airflow limitation from airway/alveolar abnormalities
definitions_glossary.FEV1: Forced expiratory volume in 1 second - key spirometry measurement
definitions_glossary.FVC: Forced vital capacity - total volume exhaled in forced breath
definitions_glossary.FEV1_FVC_ratio: FEV1 divided by FVC; <0.70 defines obstruction
definitions_glossary.post_bronchodilator: Spirometry after inhaled bronchodilator to confirm irreversibility
definitions_glossary.emphysema: Destruction of alveolar walls with air trapping
definitions_glossary.chronic_bronchitis: Cough and sputum production most days for 3+ months in 2+ consecutive years
definitions_glossary.GOLD_classification: Global Initiative for Chronic Obstructive Lung Disease staging system
definitions_glossary.exacerbation: Acute worsening of respiratory symptoms requiring treatment change
definitions_glossary.air_trapping: Incomplete lung emptying due to airway collapse
definitions_glossary.hyperinflation: Increased lung volumes from air trapping
definitions_glossary.alpha1_antitrypsin: Protease inhibitor; deficiency causes early-onset emphysema

mechanisms.small_airway_disease: Inflammation, fibrosis, mucus plugging → airway obstruction
mechanisms.emphysema: Protease-antiprotease imbalance → alveolar destruction → loss of elastic recoil
mechanisms.systemic_effects: Systemic inflammation, muscle wasting, cardiovascular comorbidity

GOLD_ABCD.Group_A: Low symptoms (mMRC 0-1, CAT <10) + 0-1 moderate exacerbation, no hospitalization
GOLD_ABCD.Group_B: High symptoms (mMRC ≥2, CAT ≥10) + 0-1 moderate exacerbation, no hospitalization
GOLD_ABCD.Group_C: Low symptoms + ≥2 moderate exacerbations OR ≥1 hospitalized exacerbation
GOLD_ABCD.Group_D: High symptoms + ≥2 moderate exacerbations OR ≥1 hospitalized exacerbation

inhaled_corticosteroids.indication: Frequent exacerbators (eosinophils >300, history of asthma overlap)
inhaled_corticosteroids.deescalation: Consider withdrawal if eosinophils <100 and no exacerbations

combination_therapy.triple_therapy: ICS/LAMA/LABA for frequent exacerbators with elevated eosinophils

non_pharmacologic: LVRS or bullectomy in selected patients

definition.@value: Chronic lung disease characterized by persistent airflow limitation due to airway and/or alveolar abnormalities, primarily caused by significant exposure to noxious particles or gases

learning_objectives: Apply GOLD staging for severity assessment
Identify candidates for ICS therapy based on eosinophils and exacerbation history
clinical_pearls: FEV1/FVC <0.70 POST-bronchodilator - reversibility suggests asthma, not COPD
Smoking cessation is THE most effective intervention - reduces mortality
Consider alpha-1 antitrypsin testing in young COPD (<45) or minimal smoking
Pulmonary rehab improves exercise capacity and quality of life

skos:related.skos:note: Differentiate from COPD; overlap syndrome exists
